alert.note: Alert for Autauga; Dallas; Elmore; Lowndes; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 2:07PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Autauga, Elmore, northwestern Lowndes, east central Dallas and northwestern Montgomery Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 207 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wetumpka to near Gardner Island. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northwestern Montgomery, Prattville, Selma, Millbrook, Wetumpka, Tallassee, Selmont-West Selmont, Elmore, Coosada, Deatsville, Eclectic, Autaugaville, White Hall, Benton, Santuck, Autauga County Airport, Titus, Ten Cedar Estates, Dexter and Mulberry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for central, south central, southeastern and east central Alabama.
